text: Social History: Patient is a 45-year-old male who reports smoking 1 pack per day for the past 20 years. He denies alcohol use. Currently employed as a construction worker. Lives with wife and two children.
The patient is a former smoker, quit 5 years ago after 30 pack-year history. She drinks 1-2 glasses of wine on weekends. Retired teacher. Lives alone in an apartment.
Social history significant for heavy alcohol use (6-8 beers daily) and marijuana use on weekends. Patient is currently unemployed and homeless, staying at a local shelter.
Non-smoker, no alcohol or illicit drug use. Patient is a graduate student living with roommates near campus.

Tobacco: Active smoker, 1/2 PPD. Alcohol: Social drinker, 2-3 drinks per week. Drugs: Denies. Employment: Disabled, unable to work due to chronic back pain. Housing: Lives with daughter who is primary caregiver.

Patient reports occasional cocaine use, last use 2 weeks ago. History of IV drug use in the past, currently in recovery program. No tobacco. Rare alcohol use. Works part-time as a cashier. Lives in group home.
Social Hx: Never smoker. No ETOH. No illicit substances. Retired from nursing 3 years ago. Widowed, lives alone. Independent with ADLs.
Active tobacco use - patient smokes cigars, approximately 2 per day. Moderate alcohol consumption. Self-employed business owner. Lives with spouse in single-family home.
